title: Temporary Activity visa (subclass 408) - Australian Government endorsed events (COVID-19 Pandemic event)
summary: This page provides detailed information about the Temporary Activity visa (subclass 408) – Australian Government endorsed events (COVID‑19 Pandemic event). The visa closed to new applications on 1 February 2024, but applications lodged before that date continue to be assessed. The content outlines what the visa allowed, eligibility rules based on application dates, obligations, and requirements for applicants.

visa_details.stream: Australian Government endorsed events (COVID-19 Pandemic event)
visa_details.description: Introduced in April 2020 to allow temporary visa holders to remain lawfully in Australia during border closures and support labour shortages in critical sectors.
visa_details.reason_for_closure: Borders reopened and temporary visa holder numbers returned to pre-COVID-19 levels.

what_this_visa_lets_you_do: Remain temporarily in Australia to work
Travel outside Australia and return while the visa is in effect

additional_fees: Charge applies for each family member added
Possible additional costs: health assessments, police certificates, other certificates or tests
cost.responsibility: Applicants are responsible for arranging and paying for additional costs.

eligibility_rules: Applicant held a COVID-19 Pandemic event visa with 28 days or less remaining at lodgement
Applicant held a COVID-19 Pandemic event visa that ceased within 28 days before lodgement
applications_2_sept_2023_to_1_feb_2024.ineligibility_consequence: If the applicant did not hold a COVID-19 Pandemic event visa at lodgement, the application is refused and may result in adverse consequences.
advice_if_ineligible: Check requirements if current visa is expiring or expired

applications_21_feb_2022_to_2_sept_2023.note: Government changes announced on 2 September 2023 do not affect undecided applications lodged during this period.

applications_before_21_feb_2022.note: Government changes announced on 2 March 2022 or 2 September 2023 do not affect undecided applications lodged before this date.

general_requirements.support_yourself: Must have sufficient funds to support yourself and any dependants.
general_requirements.health_requirements: Applicant and included family members must meet health requirements; may require a health check.
general_requirements.character_requirements: Applicants aged 16+ must meet character requirements; others may also be requested.
general_requirements.health_insurance: Must maintain adequate health insurance for entire stay.

genuine_temporary_entrant.description: Must intend to stay temporarily and not use the program for ongoing residence.
assessment_factors: Situation in Australia and home country

general_requirements.debt_to_government: Must have no outstanding debts or have arranged repayment.

visa_applicants_information.application_closure: Closed to all applications on 1 February 2024
actions_after_applying: Upload new information or respond to requests
Processing may take longer if health/character checks are required or if application is incomplete

requirements_if_travelling: Hold a visa that allows return to Australia if departing before decision
Check visa conditions and expiry in VEVO

health_exams.note: Applicants will be notified if health examinations are required.

health_insurance.note: Adequate health insurance must be maintained throughout stay.

providing_information.attach_more_information: Documents can be uploaded in ImmiAccount; additional information may be requested.

stay_lawful.requirement: Must hold a valid visa while application is processed.

bridging_visas.bva: Granted if applicant held a substantive visa at time of application
bridging_visas.bvc: Granted if applicant did not hold a substantive visa at application
conditions: Bridging visas come into effect when current visa expires
Cannot re-enter Australia on BVA or BVC
No right of return; visas cease on departure

newborn_children.note: If a child is born after applying, additional steps are required.

correcting_mistakes.instruction: Submit Form 1023 (Notification of incorrect answers) and attach it in ImmiAccount.

help_with_application.authorised_recipient: Form 956a required to appoint or withdraw
help_with_application.immigration_advice: Form 956 required for migration agent/exempt person
help_with_application.acting_on_behalf: Notify in writing by uploading advice to ImmiAccount
